rituals-symbols.name: Altar
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A structure upon which offerings such as sacrifices are made for religious purposes.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To serve as a place of offering or spiritual focus.

rituals-symbols.name: Amulet
rituals-symbols.one_liner: An object whose most important characteristic is the power ascribed to it to protect its owner from danger or harm.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To protect the wearer and bring good fortune.

rituals-symbols.name: Ankh
rituals-symbols.one_liner: An ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic symbol that was most commonly used in writing and in Egyptian art to represent the word for 'life'.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent eternal life and divine protection.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Connection to the eternal and afterlife.

rituals-symbols.name: Ashes
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The powdery residue left after burning, symbolizing mourning, repentance, and resurrection.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To signify the end of one state and the potential for rebirth.

rituals-symbols.name: Baptism
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A Christian rite of admission and adoption, almost invariably with the use of water.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To signify rebirth and the removal of sins.
steps: Immersion in or sprinkling of water
rituals-symbols.outcome: Spiritual purity and inclusion in the faith.

rituals-symbols.name: Black Rose
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A symbol of death, mourning, or tragic love, also used by anarchist movements as a sign of rebellion.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To symbolize the end of hope, tragic loss, or radical rebellion.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Marked state of dissent or grief.

rituals-symbols.name: Blood Bond
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A ritual in which two or more people mingle their blood to signify an unbreakable oath or friendship.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To create a bond deeper than legal or social contracts.
steps: Small incision on palm or thumb
rituals-symbols.outcome: Perceived permanent biological and spiritual connection.

rituals-symbols.name: Caduceus
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The staff carried by Hermes in Greek mythology, featuring two snakes winding around a winged staff.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To symbolize commerce, negotiation, and more recently, medicine.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Authority and recognized status in trade or healing.

rituals-symbols.name: Candlelight
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The use of candles to create atmosphere, focus during meditation, or symbolize hope and remembrance.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To create a sacred or focused atmosphere.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Clarity of focus or atmospheric change.

rituals-symbols.name: Ceremony
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A formal religious or public occasion, typically one celebrating a particular event or anniversary.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To honor an event, individual, or tradition with formality.

rituals-symbols.name: Coronation
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The act or ceremony of crowning a sovereign.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To invest a monarch with regal power.
rituals-symbols.participants: The monarch, religious leaders, the public

rituals-symbols.name: Exorcism
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The religious or spiritual practice of evicting demons or other spiritual entities from a person or an area.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To free an individual or location from malevolent spiritual influence.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Expulsion of the entity and restoration of spiritual health.

rituals-symbols.name: The Eye of Providence
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A symbol showing an eye, often enclosed in a triangle and surrounded by rays of light or glory, meant to represent divine providence.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To symbolize divine oversight and guidance.

rituals-symbols.name: Fasting
rituals-symbols.one_liner: Willing abstinence or reduction from some or all food, drink, or both, for a period of time.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To gain spiritual clarity, practice self-discipline, or show devotion.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Enhanced willpower and perceived spiritual purity.

rituals-symbols.name: Feast
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A large meal, typically a celebratory one, characterized by abundance and shared consumption.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To celebrate victory, mark a season, or strengthen community ties.

rituals-symbols.name: Genuflection
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The act of bending at least one knee to the ground, typically in worship or as a sign of respect.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To show profound respect, humility, or submission.

rituals-symbols.name: Handshake
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A short ritual in which two people grasp each other's right hands, often with a brief up-and-down movement.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To signify a contract, a greeting, or mutual trust.

rituals-symbols.name: Incantation
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A series of words said as a magic spell or charm.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To invoke magic or produce a supernatural effect through speech.

rituals-symbols.name: Incense
rituals-symbols.one_liner: Aromatic biotic material that releases fragrant smoke when burnt, used in religious and aesthetic practices.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To purify a space, aid meditation, or symbolize prayers rising to the divine.

rituals-symbols.name: Initiation
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A ritual marking entrance or acceptance into a group or society, or an admission to a new status.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To mark a transition in social or spiritual status.

rituals-symbols.name: Labyrinth
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A complex path used for walking meditation and as a symbol of the spiritual journey to one's center.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To facilitate contemplative prayer or walking meditation.

rituals-symbols.name: Laurel Wreath
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A circular wreath made of interlocking branches and leaves of the bay laurel, representing victory and honor.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To honor a victor, poet, or scholar.

rituals-symbols.name: Libation
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A drink poured out as an offering to a deity or in memory of a dead person.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To honor the dead or a higher power.

rituals-symbols.name: The Lotus Flower
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A flower that grows in muddy water and rises above the surface to bloom with remarkable beauty and purity.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To symbolize spiritual awakening and purity.

rituals-symbols.name: Mandala
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A geometric configuration of symbols used in various spiritual traditions as a tool for focus and meditation.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent the cosmos and serve as a map for spiritual guidance.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Mental clarity and recognition of universal unity.

rituals-symbols.name: Olive Branch
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A symbol of peace or victory, originally from ancient Greek tradition.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To signify the end of a conflict or a desire for reconciliation.

rituals-symbols.name: Omen
rituals-symbols.one_liner: An event regarded as a portent of good or evil.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To predict future events based on symbolic signs.

rituals-symbols.name: Ouroboros
rituals-symbols.one_liner: An ancient symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent the infinite cycle of life, death, and rebirth.

rituals-symbols.name: Pentagram
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A five-pointed star, often used as a religious or magical symbol.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent the five elements or provide protection/invocation in magic.

rituals-symbols.name: Pilgrimage
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A journey, often into an unknown or foreign place, where a person goes in search of new or expanded meaning about their self, others, nature, or a higher power.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To seek spiritual growth, penance, or direct contact with the sacred.

rituals-symbols.name: Purification
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A ritual intended to remove spiritual or physical impurity.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To remove impurity and prepare for sacred work.

rituals-symbols.name: Red Rose
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The universal symbol of romantic love and passion, often associated with secrecy (sub rosa).
rituals-symbols.purpose: To express love, desire, or to mark a secret agreement.

rituals-symbols.name: Sacrifice
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The act of giving up something valued for the sake of something else regarded as more important or worthy.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To appease, honor, or petition a higher power or goal.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Favored status, achieved goal, spiritual debt paid

rituals-symbols.name: Scarification
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The practice of etching, burning, or branding designs, pictures, or words into the skin as a permanent ritual mark.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To signify tribal belonging, social status, or personal strength.
steps: Irritating the wound to ensure scarring

rituals-symbols.name: Seance
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A meeting at which people attempt to make contact with the dead, especially through the agency of a medium.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To communicate with spirits or the deceased.
steps: Gathering in a quiet dark space
rituals-symbols.outcome: Messages from the deceased or spiritual manifestations.

rituals-symbols.name: Sigil
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A type of symbol used in ritual magic, representing a specific intent or entity.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent and manifest a specific magical desire or entity.

rituals-symbols.name: Swearing on the Grave
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A powerful vow made using the memory or physical location of a deceased loved one as a guarantee of truth.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To provide the ultimate guarantee of truth or commitment.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Maximal social and personal commitment to an oath.

rituals-symbols.name: Taboo
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A social or religious custom prohibiting or forbidding discussion of a particular practice or forbidding association with a particular person, place, or thing.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To maintain social order or protect individuals from perceived danger/sin.

rituals-symbols.name: Tarot
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A deck of cards used for fortune-telling, divination, and psychological exploration.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To gain insight into the past, present, or future.

rituals-symbols.name: Tattoo
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The permanent marking of the skin with ink, serving as a ritual of identity, trauma, or status.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To signify belonging, commemorate events, or enhance aesthetic appeal permanently.

rituals-symbols.name: The Long Walk
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A ritual of endurance or forced migration, representing the peak of physical and mental resilience.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To test limits, survive a transition, or commemorate a journey.

rituals-symbols.name: The Silent Hour
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A personal or communal ritual of total silence, often practiced at dawn or midnight for spiritual clarity.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To facilitate deep listening and internal focus.

rituals-symbols.name: The Skull
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A universal symbol of mortality, used in 'Memento Mori' art to remind viewers of the transience of life.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To serve as a reminder of death or a warning of danger.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Humility before death or intimidation of enemies.

rituals-symbols.name: The Veiling
rituals-symbols.one_liner: The ritual act of covering the head or body to signify modesty, mystery, or sacredness.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To protect, separate from the profane, or signify religious devotion.

rituals-symbols.name: Toast
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A ritual in which a drink is taken as an expression of honor or goodwill.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To honor a person, celebrate an achievement, or strengthen a bond.

rituals-symbols.name: Totem
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A natural object or animal believed by a particular society to have spiritual significance and adopted by it as an emblem.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent a group's identity and provide spiritual connection/protection.

rituals-symbols.name: The Tree of Life
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A widespread myth or archetype in the world's mythologies, religious and philosophical traditions, related to the concept of a sacred tree.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent the connection of all life and the structure of the cosmos.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Understanding of universal unity and lineage.

rituals-symbols.name: Vigil
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A period of keeping awake during the time usually devoted to sleep, especially to keep watch or pray.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To show respect, wait for an event, or protect something.

rituals-symbols.name: White Flag
rituals-symbols.one_liner: An internationally recognized protective symbol of truce or surrender from further hostile action.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To communicate a desire for peace or a cease-fire.
rituals-symbols.outcome: Cessation of hostilities or temporary safety.

rituals-symbols.name: Yin and Yang
rituals-symbols.one_liner: A Chinese philosophical concept that describes how obviously opposite or contrary forces may actually be complementary, interconnected, and interdependent.
rituals-symbols.purpose: To represent the interconnectedness of all dualities.

science-future.name: Anti-gravity
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical technology that would allow an object to be free from the influence of gravity.
science-future.hypothesis: Mass can be shielded or gravity can be reversed using exotic matter or fields.

science-future.name: Antimatter
science-future.one_liner: Matter composed of the antiparticles of those which constitute ordinary matter.
science-future.hypothesis: Every particle has an antiparticle counterpart with opposite charge.

science-future.name: Artificial General Intelligence
science-future.one_liner: A theoretical form of AI that has the capacity to understand, learn, and apply knowledge across a broad range of tasks at a human or super-human level.
science-future.hypothesis: That it is possible to create a machine with general-purpose intelligence equivalent to or greater than humans.

science-future.name: Asteroid Mining
science-future.one_liner: The hypothetical exploitation of materials from asteroids and other minor planets, including near-Earth objects.
science-future.hypothesis: Asteroids contain enough raw materials to fuel a post-scarcity space economy.

science-future.name: Bio-Computation
science-future.one_liner: The use of biological components, such as DNA or neurons, to perform computational tasks.
science-future.hypothesis: Biological systems can be engineered to process information more efficiently than silicon.

science-future.name: Black Hole
science-future.one_liner: A region of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing—no particles or even electromagnetic radiation such as light—can escape from it.
science-future.hypothesis: Massive stars collapse into a singularity of infinite density.

science-future.name: Boltzmann Brain
science-future.one_liner: A thought experiment suggesting that it is more likely for a single brain to spontaneously form in a void than for the entire universe to come into being as it has.
science-future.hypothesis: Fluctuations in a vacuum could create a conscious observer with false memories.

science-future.name: Cold Fusion
science-future.one_liner: A hypothesized type of nuclear reaction that would occur at, or near, room temperature.
science-future.hypothesis: Fusion can be achieved without the extreme heat of stars.

science-future.name: Cryonics
science-future.one_liner: The low-temperature freezing and storage of a human corpse or severed head, with the speculative hope that resurrection may be possible in the future.
science-future.hypothesis: Biological information can be preserved at ultra-low temperatures until medical tech catches up.

science-future.name: Cyborgization
science-future.one_liner: The process of integrating biological and artificial systems to enhance or restore human capabilities.
science-future.hypothesis: That human biological limits can be overcome through technology.

science-future.name: Dark Matter
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical form of matter that is believed to make up approximately 85% of the matter in the universe.
bar_seeds: holding it together from the shadows
science-future.hypothesis: A vast amount of matter exists that does not emit or interact with electromagnetic radiation.

science-future.name: Dyson Sphere
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical megastructure that completely encompasses a star and captures a large percentage of its solar power output.
science-future.hypothesis: A sufficiently advanced civilization (Kardashev Type II) would build such a structure for energy needs.

science-future.name: Dyson Swarm
science-future.one_liner: A more realistic version of a Dyson Sphere, consisting of millions of independent power-collecting satellites orbiting a star.
science-future.hypothesis: Stars can be incrementally wrapped in satellites to capture nearly all radiant energy.
ethical_concerns: Occlusion of light for other worlds

science-future.name: Entropy
science-future.one_liner: A thermodynamic property that is a measure of the system's thermal energy per unit temperature that is unavailable for doing useful work.
science-future.hypothesis: Total entropy of an isolated system can never decrease over time.

science-future.name: Exoplanets
science-future.one_liner: Planets that orbit a star outside the solar system.
science-future.hypothesis: Earth-like planets are common in the galaxy and potentially harbor life.

science-future.name: Fermi Paradox
science-future.one_liner: The conflict between the lack of clear, obvious evidence for extraterrestrial life and various high estimates for their existence.
science-future.hypothesis: Given the age and scale of the universe, we should see aliens; why don't we?
ethical_concerns: Meaning of human existence if alone

science-future.name: Gene Drive
science-future.one_liner: A genetic engineering technology that can propagate a particular suite of genes throughout a population.
science-future.hypothesis: Genes can be designed to force their own inheritance, bypassing natural selection.

science-future.name: Genetic Engineering
science-future.one_liner: The direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology.
science-future.hypothesis: That we can selectively edit the human genome to improve health and capabilities.
ethical_concerns: Permanent changes to the gene pool

science-future.name: Gray Goo
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical global catastrophic scenario involving molecular nanotechnology in which out-of-control self-replicating robots consume all biomass on Earth.
science-future.hypothesis: Self-replicating nanobots could fail to stop, converting everything into more nanobots.
implications: Earth as a featureless ball of dust

science-future.name: Kardashev Scale
science-future.one_liner: A method of measuring a civilization's level of technological advancement based on the amount of energy they are able to use.
science-future.hypothesis: Civilizations can be categorized by their energy consumption: Planetary (I), Stellar (II), and Galactic (III).

science-future.name: Lab-Grown Meat
science-future.one_liner: Meat produced by in vitro cultivation of animal cells, instead of from slaughtered animals.
science-future.hypothesis: Real animal tissue can be grown sustainably from stem cells.

science-future.name: Life Extension
science-future.one_liner: The study of slowing down or reversing the processes of aging to extend both the maximum and average lifespan.
science-future.hypothesis: Aging is a biological process that can be managed or cured.
ethical_concerns: The meaning of life without death

science-future.name: Matrioshka Brain
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical megastructure capable of processing enormous amounts of data by consuming the entire power output of a star.
science-future.hypothesis: Computing power is limited only by the energy and matter available in a star system.

science-future.name: Mind Uploading
science-future.one_liner: The hypothetical process of scanning a physical structure of the brain and copying its state into a computer.
science-future.hypothesis: Consciousness can be treated as data and transferred to new substrate.

science-future.name: Multiverse Theory
science-future.one_liner: The hypothetical set of all possible universes, including the universe in which we live.
science-future.hypothesis: Our universe is just one of many, possibly infinite, universes with different physical constants or histories.
implications: Meaning of individual choice is diluted

science-future.name: Nanobots
science-future.one_liner: Robots whose components are at or near the scale of a nanometer.
science-future.hypothesis: Machines can be built to manipulate matter at the molecular level.

science-future.name: Nanotechnology
science-future.one_liner: The manipulation of matter on an atomic, molecular, and supramolecular scale.
science-future.hypothesis: That we can build machines and materials from the atom up.

science-future.name: Neural Lace
science-future.one_liner: A mesh-like electronic interface that grows with and around the brain, enabling high-bandwidth symbiotic AI connection.
bar_seeds: growing the web in the skull
science-future.hypothesis: A flexible, injectable mesh can merge with the brain's circulatory or nervous system.
implications: Direct access to internet through thought

science-future.name: Neuralink
science-future.one_liner: A neurotechnology company developing implantable brain-computer interfaces (BCIs).
science-future.hypothesis: High-bandwidth connection between the human brain and computers is possible and necessary.

science-future.name: Nuclear Fusion
science-future.one_liner: The process of powering the stars, harnessed on Earth to provide safe, clean, and virtually limitless energy.
science-future.hypothesis: Fusing hydrogen isotopes to release energy without long-lived radioactive waste.

science-future.name: Post-Human Society
science-future.one_liner: A future social order in which the dominant beings are no longer purely biological humans.
science-future.hypothesis: Technological evolution will create a new successor species or variety of species.
implications: End of human history as we know it

science-future.name: Programmable Matter
science-future.one_liner: Matter which has the ability to alter its physical properties (shape, density, moduli, conductivity, optical properties, etc.) in a programmable fashion.
science-future.hypothesis: Information can be encoded directly into matter to control its macroscopic form.

science-future.name: Quantum Entanglement
science-future.one_liner: A physical phenomenon that occurs when a group of particles are generated, interact, or share spatial proximity such that the quantum state of each particle cannot be described independently of the state of the others.
bar_seeds: what happens to me happens to you
science-future.hypothesis: Particles remain connected such that the state of one instantaneously affects the other, regardless of distance.

science-future.name: Quantum Supremacy
science-future.one_liner: The point where a quantum computer can solve a problem that no classical computer can solve in a reasonable amount of time.
science-future.hypothesis: Quantum gates can perform parallel calculations impossible for classical binary bits.

science-future.name: Simulation Point
science-future.one_liner: The theoretical point in technological advancement where it becomes possible to create a simulation indistinguishable from reality.
science-future.hypothesis: Computing power will eventually allow for perfect ancestor simulations.

science-future.name: The Singularity
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical point in time at which technological growth becomes uncontrollable and irreversible, resulting in unfathomable changes to human civilization.
science-future.hypothesis: That AI will eventually trigger runaway self-improvement, surpassing human intelligence.
implications: End of human history as we know it
ethical_concerns: The divide between those who ascend and those who don't

science-future.name: Space Colonization
science-future.one_liner: The hypothetical permanent human habitation and exploitation of natural resources outside of Earth.
science-future.hypothesis: Humanity must expand beyond Earth to ensure long-term survival.

science-future.name: Space Elevator
science-future.one_liner: A proposed type of planet-to-space transportation system using a cable reaching from the surface into orbit.
science-future.hypothesis: A cable made of carbon nanotubes can be strong enough to support an elevator to geostationary orbit.

science-future.name: Superintelligence
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical agent that possesses intelligence far surpassing that of the brightest and most gifted human minds.
science-future.hypothesis: AI will eventually surpass human cognition across all domains.

science-future.name: Teleportation
science-future.one_liner: The theoretical transfer of matter or energy from one point to another without traversing the physical space between them.
bar_seeds: atom to bit back to atom
science-future.hypothesis: Information about a quantum state can be transmitted to reconstruct a particle at another location.
ethical_concerns: Is the teleported person the same person?

science-future.name: Terraforming
science-future.one_liner: The hypothetical process of deliberately modifying the atmosphere, temperature, surface topography, or ecology of a planet to make it habitable by humans.
science-future.hypothesis: Planets like Mars or Venus can be engineered to support Earth-like life.

science-future.name: The Great Filter
science-future.one_liner: A hypothetical barrier that prevents civilizations from becoming interstellar or lasting for long periods.
angles: is it behind us or ahead
science-future.hypothesis: There is a stage in evolution that is extremely difficult to pass, explaining why we see no aliens.

science-future.name: Type I Civilization
science-future.one_liner: A civilization that can use and store all of the energy available on its home planet.
science-future.hypothesis: Humanity's next major milestone in energy consumption and technological scale.

science-future.name: Type II Civilization
science-future.one_liner: A civilization that can harness the total energy output of its parent star.
science-future.hypothesis: Civilizations will eventually build structures to capture 100% of their star's output.

science-future.name: Type III Civilization
science-future.one_liner: A civilization that can control the energy of its entire host galaxy.
science-future.hypothesis: The ultimate stage of technological development before crossing into trans-universal power.

science-future.name: Vertical Farming
science-future.one_liner: The practice of growing crops in vertically stacked layers, often incorporating controlled-environment agriculture.
science-future.hypothesis: Food production can be brought into cities and optimized using minimal space/water.

science-future.name: Von Neumann Probe
science-future.one_liner: A self-replicating spacecraft designed to explore the galaxy.
science-future.hypothesis: Autonomous machines can be sent to other star systems to build copies of themselves and continue the mission.
ethical_concerns: Resource consumption of entire star systems

science-future.name: Wormhole
science-future.one_liner: A speculative structure linking disparate points in spacetime, based on a special solution of the Einstein field equations.
science-future.hypothesis: Spacetime can be warped to connect two distant points directly.

time-energy.name: Blue Hour
time-energy.one_liner: The twilight period when the sun is far below the horizon and the sky takes on a deep blue hue.
time-energy.physics_basis: Chappuis absorption of sunlight by the ozone layer.
time-energy.cultural_view: A time of introspection and transition; the 'l'heure bleue'.

time-energy.name: Burnout
time-energy.one_liner: The state of physical or emotional exhaustion involving a sense of reduced accomplishment.
time-energy.cultural_view: The dark side of 'hustle culture' and constant productivity.

time-energy.name: The Butterfly Effect
time-energy.one_liner: The phenomenon whereby a small change at one place in a complex system can have large effects elsewhere.
time-energy.cultural_view: A warning about the power of small actions and the complexity of history.

time-energy.name: Circadian Rhythm
time-energy.one_liner: The natural, internal process that regulates the sleep-wake cycle and repeats roughly every 24 hours.
time-energy.cultural_view: The foundation of health and the baseline for human daily life.

time-energy.name: Critical Mass
time-energy.one_liner: The minimum amount of fissile material needed to maintain a nuclear chain reaction; also used to describe a social tipping point.
time-energy.perception: High tension, followed by an unstoppable surge.
time-energy.cultural_view: The moment an idea or movement becomes unstoppable.

time-energy.name: Dark Energy
time-energy.one_liner: A mysterious force that is believed to make up 68% of the universe and is responsible for its accelerating expansion.
time-energy.cultural_view: The ultimate unknown factor driving the universe.

time-energy.name: Decay
time-energy.one_liner: The organic or mechanical process of breaking down over time.
time-energy.cultural_view: Symbolic of mortality, the passage of time, and lost grandeur.

time-energy.name: Déjà Vu
time-energy.one_liner: The eerie feeling that one has already experienced the present situation.
time-energy.cultural_view: Often interpreted as a sign of fate or a past life.

time-energy.name: Electricity
time-energy.one_liner: The set of physical phenomena associated with the presence and motion of matter that has a property of electric charge.
time-energy.perception: Buzzing, energetic, and foundational to modern life.
time-energy.cultural_view: Represents life, ideas, and sudden shock.

time-energy.name: Entropy
time-energy.one_liner: The thermodynamic measure of disorder and the inevitable decline into chaos.
time-energy.perception: A sense of gradual, irreversible loss and spreading randomness.
time-energy.cultural_view: Often used as a metaphor for social or personal decline.

time-energy.name: Era
time-energy.one_liner: A long and distinct period of history with a particular feature or characteristic.
time-energy.cultural_view: Used to group styles, people, and events into coherent blocks (e.g., 'Golden Era').

time-energy.name: Eternal Return
time-energy.one_liner: The philosophical concept that the universe and all existence has been recurring, and will continue to recur.
time-energy.perception: Dizzying, heavy, and potentially liberating or terrifying.
time-energy.cultural_view: A challenge to live life such that one would be happy to repeat it infinitely.

time-energy.name: Event Horizon
time-energy.one_liner: The boundary around a black hole beyond which nothing can escape.
time-energy.perception: The ultimate boundary between the known and the unknown.
time-energy.cultural_view: Used as a metaphor for irreversible life choices or absolute boundaries.

time-energy.name: Fate
time-energy.one_liner: The development of events beyond a person's control, regarded as determined by a supernatural power.
time-energy.perception: A feeling of powerlessness mixed with purpose.
time-energy.cultural_view: Often seen as a tragic or heroic burden.

time-energy.name: Flow State
time-energy.one_liner: The mental state of being fully immersed and focused on an activity, where time seems to disappear.
time-energy.perception: Hyper-focused, losing self-consciousness and the sense of time passing.
time-energy.cultural_view: Highly valued in creative and athletic pursuits; 'the zone'.

time-energy.name: Free Will
time-energy.one_liner: The ability to choose between different possible courses of action unimpeded.
time-energy.perception: A sense of autonomy and responsibility.
time-energy.cultural_view: The bedrock of legal and moral responsibility.

time-energy.name: Frequency
time-energy.one_liner: The rate at which something occurs or is repeated over a particular period of time or in a given sample.
time-energy.physics_basis: The number of cycles per unit of time (Hertz).
time-energy.cultural_view: Used metaphorically for mental state and social connection.

time-energy.name: Golden Hour
time-energy.one_liner: The period shortly after sunrise or before sunset when the light is redder and softer.
time-energy.physics_basis: Atmospheric scattering of sunlight at low angles.
time-energy.cultural_view: The peak time for photography and romanticized reflection.

time-energy.name: Gravity
time-energy.one_liner: The natural phenomenon by which all things with mass or energy are brought toward one another.
time-energy.cultural_view: Represents the 'real world', limitations, and fundamental connection.
idioms: What goes up must come down

time-energy.name: Half-Life
time-energy.one_liner: The time required for a quantity to reduce to half of its initial value.
time-energy.perception: A sense of gradual but predictable vanishing.
time-energy.cultural_view: Often associated with nuclear waste or the 'lingering' of fame or trauma.

time-energy.name: Heat Death
time-energy.one_liner: The ultimate fate of the universe in which it has evolved to a state of no thermodynamic free energy.
time-energy.perception: Total finality, absolute cold, and ultimate peace or horror.
time-energy.physics_basis: Maximization of entropy in an expanding universe.
time-energy.cultural_view: The grand finale of existence; the ultimate 'it's over'.

time-energy.name: High Noon
time-energy.one_liner: Midday, when the sun is at its highest point in the sky; a time for confrontation.
time-energy.cultural_view: The classic time for a duel; the moment of truth.

time-energy.name: Infinity
time-energy.one_liner: The state or quality of being infinite; boundless space, time, or quantity.
time-energy.cultural_view: Associated with the divine, the universe, and reincarnation.

time-energy.name: Jet Lag
time-energy.one_liner: The disruption of body rhythms caused by rapid travel across time zones.
time-energy.perception: Drowsy, confused, and physically out of sync with the environment.
time-energy.cultural_view: A status symbol of the global traveler, but a physical burden.

time-energy.name: Karma
time-energy.one_liner: The principle of cause and effect where intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that individual.
time-energy.perception: A sense of cosmic justice and inevitability.
time-energy.cultural_view: Universal belief in 'you reap what you sow'.

time-energy.name: Kinetic Energy
time-energy.one_liner: The energy an object possesses due to its motion.
time-energy.perception: Active, powerful, and dangerous if interrupted.
time-energy.cultural_view: Symbolizes progress, action, and the power of doing.

time-energy.name: Light Waves
time-energy.one_liner: Electromagnetic radiation that can be perceived by the human eye.
time-energy.cultural_view: Represents knowledge, truth, and hope.

time-energy.name: Magnetism
time-energy.one_liner: A physical phenomenon produced by the motion of electric charge, resulting in attractive and repulsive forces.
time-energy.perception: Unseen but undeniable force pulling things together or pushing them apart.
time-energy.cultural_view: Commonly used to describe charisma or intense relationships.
idioms: Drawn like a moth to a flame

time-energy.name: Momentum
time-energy.one_liner: The quantity of motion of a moving body, measured as a product of its mass and velocity.
time-energy.cultural_view: Valued in business, sports, and creative output.

time-energy.name: Nuclear Energy
time-energy.one_liner: The energy released during nuclear fission or fusion, especially when used to generate electricity.
time-energy.physics_basis: Fission or fusion of atomic nuclei.
time-energy.cultural_view: Associated with both the progress of the atomic age and the fear of extinction.

time-energy.name: Perpetual Motion
time-energy.one_liner: Motion of ad-infinitum devices that can continue to do work indefinitely without an external energy source.
time-energy.physics_basis: Violates the First or Second Law of Thermodynamics.
time-energy.cultural_view: A symbol of the search for the impossible and eternal efficiency.

time-energy.name: Potential Energy
time-energy.one_liner: The energy possessed by a body by virtue of its position relative to others, stresses within itself, electric charge, and other factors.
time-energy.physics_basis: Energy stored in an object due to its position or state (U = mgh).
time-energy.cultural_view: Metaphor for talent or opportunity that has yet to be used.

time-energy.name: Quantum Leap
time-energy.one_liner: An abrupt, non-linear transition from one state to another without passing through intermediate stages.
time-energy.cultural_view: A metaphor for huge progress or change in a short time.

time-energy.name: Resonance
time-energy.one_liner: The quality in a sound of being deep, full, and reverberating.
time-energy.perception: Deep connection, physical vibration, and lasting impact.
time-energy.physics_basis: When a system vibrates at its natural frequency due to an external force.
time-energy.cultural_view: Metaphor for ideas that 'land' or people who connect deeply.

time-energy.name: Solar Energy
time-energy.one_liner: Radiant light and heat from the Sun that is harnessed using a range of technologies.
time-energy.cultural_view: Symbol of sustainability and the optimistic future.

time-energy.name: Sound Waves
time-energy.one_liner: A wave of compression and rarefaction, by which sound is propagated in an elastic medium such as air.
time-energy.cultural_view: The medium of music and voice; the power of the word.

time-energy.name: Stasis
time-energy.one_liner: A period or state of inactivity or equilibrium.
time-energy.cultural_view: Can be seen as either meditative peace or death-like stagnation.

time-energy.name: Static
time-energy.one_liner: Background noise, interference, or a state of unchanging energy.
time-energy.perception: Constant, potentially irritating, or oddly comforting (as white noise).
time-energy.cultural_view: Associated with dead air, lost connections, and the 'void'.

time-energy.name: Synchronicity
time-energy.one_liner: The simultaneous occurrence of events that appear significantly related but have no discernible causal connection.
time-energy.physics_basis: Jungian theory of acausal connecting principle.
time-energy.cultural_view: Interpreted as the universe sending a message or sign.

time-energy.name: Temporal Paradox
time-energy.one_liner: A logical contradiction resulting from time travel, where an event prevents its own cause.
time-energy.cultural_view: A staple of science fiction used to explore cause and effect.

time-energy.name: The Big Bang
time-energy.one_liner: The rapid expansion of matter from a state of extremely high density and temperature that marked the origin of the universe.
time-energy.cultural_view: The ultimate scientific origin story.

time-energy.name: The Future
time-energy.one_liner: The time that is to come; the time after the present.
time-energy.physics_basis: The region of spacetime ahead of the present moment.
time-energy.cultural_view: Associated with progress, technological advancement, and destiny.
idioms: The best is yet to come

time-energy.name: The Past
time-energy.one_liner: The set of all events that occurred before a given point in time.
time-energy.physics_basis: The region of spacetime behind the present moment.
time-energy.cultural_view: Associated with history, lessons, and ancestors.

time-energy.name: The Present
time-energy.one_liner: The time that is associated with the events perceived directly and in the first time.
time-energy.physics_basis: The current point on the world-line of an observer.
time-energy.cultural_view: Valued in mindfulness and carpe diem philosophies.

time-energy.name: The Speed of Light
time-energy.one_liner: The universal speed limit, roughly 300,000 kilometers per second.
time-energy.cultural_view: The ultimate benchmark for speed and technical perfection.

time-energy.name: Tidal Force
time-energy.one_liner: The effect of the gravitational pull of one body on another, resulting in the regular rise and fall of sea levels.
time-energy.cultural_view: Metaphor for the changing of fortunes and the power of the moon.

time-energy.name: Time Dilation
time-energy.one_liner: The difference in the elapsed time as measured by two clocks, either due to a relative velocity between them or to a difference in gravitational potential between their locations.
bar_seeds: minute for me year for you
time-energy.hypothesis: Time is relative, not absolute, and can be stretched by speed or mass.
implications: One-way time travel to the future

time-energy.name: Vibration
time-energy.one_liner: An instance of vibrating; a person's emotional state, the atmosphere of a place, or the associations of an object.
time-energy.physics_basis: Mechanical oscillations about an equilibrium point.
time-energy.cultural_view: Central to 'vibe' culture and various spiritual beliefs about energy.

time-energy.name: Wind Energy
time-energy.one_liner: The use of wind to provide mechanical power through wind turbines to turn electric generators.
time-energy.physics_basis: Conversion of wind's kinetic energy to mechanical power.
time-energy.cultural_view: Symbol of man working with nature's forces.

time-energy.name: Witching Hour
time-energy.one_liner: A time of night associated with supernatural events, traditionally midnight or 3 AM.
time-energy.perception: Eerie, quiet, and heavy with potential dread or revelation.
time-energy.cultural_view: The time when the veil between worlds is thinnest.

time-energy.name: Zero Point Energy
time-energy.one_liner: The lowest possible energy that a quantum mechanical system may have.
time-energy.perception: A sense of infinite potential hidden in nothingness.
time-energy.cultural_view: Often featured in sci-fi as a source of clean, infinite power.

vehicles.name: Aston Martin DB5
vehicles.one_liner: The most famous car in the world, forever linked to James Bond.
vehicles.cultural_status: The eternal symbol of cinematic espionage and British class.

vehicles.name: Bentley Continental GT
vehicles.one_liner: The definitive grand tourer, blending massive power with gentlemanly luxury.
vehicles.cultural_status: A staple of high-net-worth garages and rap lyrics.

vehicles.name: Bugatti Veyron
vehicles.one_liner: A masterpiece of engineering that redefined the limits of road-car performance and speed.
vehicles.cultural_status: A symbol of ultimate automotive achievement and extreme wealth.

vehicles.name: Cadillac Escalade
vehicles.one_liner: The massive American luxury SUV that defined early 2000s bling culture.
vehicles.cultural_status: The VIP transport of choice for rappers and executives alike.

vehicles.name: Cadillac Fleetwood
vehicles.one_liner: A classic American luxury sedan representing old-school prestige and comfort.
vehicles.cultural_status: An icon of 20th-century American luxury and a favorite for custom lowriders.

vehicles.name: Checker Taxi
vehicles.one_liner: The iconic yellow cab that defined New York City streets for decades.
vehicles.cultural_status: The universal symbol of NYC urban life.

vehicles.name: Chevrolet Impala '64
vehicles.one_liner: The quintessential lowrider canvas, immortalized by West Coast hip-hop.
vehicles.cultural_status: The official car of West Coast G-Funk.

vehicles.name: DeLorean DMC-12
vehicles.one_liner: A stainless steel sports car with gull-wing doors, famous for traveling through time.
vehicles.cultural_status: A pop culture icon thanks to Back to the Future.

vehicles.name: Dodge Challenger Hellcat
vehicles.one_liner: A modern muscle car defined by excessive horsepower and tire smoke.
vehicles.cultural_status: The modern street king of sheer displacement and noise.

vehicles.name: Ducati Panigale V4
vehicles.one_liner: A high-tech Italian superbike that brings MotoGP performance to the street.
vehicles.cultural_status: The Ferrari of two wheels.

vehicles.name: Ferrari F40
vehicles.one_liner: A legendary mid-engine, rear-wheel drive sports car that redefined performance in the late 80s.
vehicles.cultural_status: Regarded as one of the greatest supercars ever made; a collector's dream.

vehicles.name: Ford Bronco (1st Gen)
vehicles.one_liner: A rugged, boxy off-roader that became a classic American SUV icon.
vehicles.cultural_status: A collector's item representing rugged individualism.

vehicles.name: Ford Mustang GT
vehicles.one_liner: The pony car that started it all, representing accessible American speed.
vehicles.cultural_status: A symbol of American freedom and teenage rebellion.

vehicles.name: Gulfstream G650
vehicles.one_liner: The ultimate ultra-long-range business jet for the global elite.
vehicles.cultural_status: The gold standard of billionaire travel (referenced incorrectly as 'G6' often).

vehicles.name: Harley-Davidson Fat Boy
vehicles.one_liner: The muscular cruiser made famous by the Terminator.
vehicles.cultural_status: The symbol of American heavyweight cruising.

vehicles.name: Lamborghini Aventador
vehicles.one_liner: A mid-engine supercar that epitomizes aggressive design, extreme performance, and wealth.
vehicles.cultural_status: Top-tier status symbol in hip-hop and business.

vehicles.name: Lamborghini Countach
vehicles.one_liner: The wedge-shaped poster car that defined the 80s supercar aesthetic.
vehicles.cultural_status: The archetype of the 'bedroom wall' poster car.

vehicles.name: Learjet 23
vehicles.one_liner: The pioneer of the private business jet industry.
vehicles.cultural_status: The original symbol of corporate success.

vehicles.name: Lowrider
vehicles.one_liner: A customized vehicle, typically a classic American car, with a lowered chassis and hydraulic suspension.
vehicles.cultural_status: An iconic symbol of Chicano and West Coast hip-hop culture.

vehicles.name: Maybach 62
vehicles.one_liner: An ultra-luxury chauffeur-driven limousine known for its fully reclining rear seats.
vehicles.cultural_status: The ultimate symbol of early 2000s rap opulence.

vehicles.name: McLaren F1
vehicles.one_liner: The gold-standard 90s supercar with a central driving position and gold-lined engine bay.
vehicles.cultural_status: The greatest analog supercar ever built.

vehicles.name: Mercedes-Benz G-Wagon
vehicles.one_liner: A luxury SUV that combines military-grade durability with high-end status and performance.
vehicles.cultural_status: Highly popular among celebrities and the wealthy for its imposing presence.

vehicles.name: Nissan Skyline GT-R R34
vehicles.one_liner: Godzilla. The technologically advanced JDM masterpiece forbidden in the US for decades.
vehicles.cultural_status: The ultimate forbidden fruit of car culture.

vehicles.name: Porsche 911
vehicles.one_liner: The definitive rear-engine sports car, known for its timeless design and precision engineering.
vehicles.cultural_status: An icon of taste and engineering excellence.

vehicles.name: Range Rover
vehicles.one_liner: The definitive luxury SUV, combining British elegance with serious off-road capability.
vehicles.cultural_status: A staple of high-end suburban and celebrity lifestyle.

vehicles.name: Rolls-Royce Phantom
vehicles.one_liner: The absolute pinnacle of automotive luxury and a symbol of ultimate success.
vehicles.cultural_status: The gold standard for luxury and achievement.

vehicles.name: Tesla Cybertruck
vehicles.one_liner: A polarizing, stainless steel electric polygon straight out of a dystopian future.
vehicles.cultural_status: A meme, a status symbol, and a brutalist statement piece.

vehicles.name: Tesla Model S
vehicles.one_liner: The electric sedan that brought sustainable performance and high-tech luxury to the mainstream.
vehicles.cultural_status: A symbol of tech-forward wealth and innovation.

vehicles.name: Toyota Supra MK4
vehicles.one_liner: The 90s JDM legend, famous for its bulletproof 2JZ engine and massive tuning potential.
vehicles.cultural_status: Street racing icon made immortal by Fast & Furious.

vehicles.name: Vespa
vehicles.one_liner: The classic Italian scooter synonymous with style and urban mobility.
vehicles.cultural_status: An icon of Italian design and mod culture.

weapons-objects.name: AK-47
weapons-objects.one_liner: The most widely used and recognizable assault rifle in the world, a symbol of both revolution and street power.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Revolution, resistance, and raw street power.

weapons-objects.name: Analog Clock
weapons-objects.one_liner: A device for measuring and showing time, characterized by moving hands and a numbered face.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Inevitability, mortality, pressure, and organization.

weapons-objects.name: AR-15
weapons-objects.one_liner: The modular and highly popular semi-automatic rifle platform in the United States.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Modern warfare, tactical precision, and social controversy.

weapons-objects.name: Balaclava
weapons-objects.one_liner: A cloth headgear that conceals identity, leaving only the eyes as witnesses.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Mystery, criminal intent, and the loss of individual identity in the collective.

weapons-objects.name: Baseball Bat
weapons-objects.one_liner: A sporting tool repurposed for heavy-duty blunt force.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Enforcement, direct consequences, and American grit.

weapons-objects.name: Bo Staff
weapons-objects.one_liner: A long staff used in Japanese martial arts, emphasizing leverage and reach.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Non-lethal mastery, monk-like discipline, and defensive capability.

weapons-objects.name: Brass Key
weapons-objects.one_liner: A classic metal tool that grants access to hidden or protected spaces.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Knowledge, entry into exclusive circles, and the revealing of secrets.

weapons-objects.name: Brass Knuckles
weapons-objects.one_liner: A simple but effective weapon designed to enhance the power of a punch.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Street toughness, dirty fighting, and physical aggression.

weapons-objects.name: Bulletproof Vest
weapons-objects.one_liner: Protective body armor that signifies both high-risk and survival.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Preparation, survivalism, and the reality of constant threat.

weapons-objects.name: Burner Phone
weapons-objects.one_liner: A cheap, disposable mobile phone used to maintain anonymity.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Ephemeral connections, criminal pragmatism, and untraceable presence.

weapons-objects.name: Butterfly Knife
weapons-objects.one_liner: A folding pocketknife with two handles counter-rotating around the tang, known for the skill required to open it.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Agility, skill, street flair, and hidden danger.

weapons-objects.name: C4 Explosive
weapons-objects.one_liner: A common variety of plastic explosive known for its malleability and stability.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Calculated destruction, sabotage, and covert operations.

weapons-objects.name: Chainsaw
weapons-objects.one_liner: A portable gasoline, electric, or battery-powered saw that cuts with a set of teeth attached to a rotating chain.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Brutal force, horror tropes, and unstoppable destruction.

weapons-objects.name: Compass
weapons-objects.one_liner: An instrument containing a magnetized pointer that shows the direction of magnetic north.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Moral clarity, finding one's way, and steadfastness in purpose.

weapons-objects.name: Crowbar
weapons-objects.one_liner: A heavy iron lever with a bent end, used for prying things open.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Forced entry, utility under pressure, and scientific heroism (Half-Life).

weapons-objects.name: Crown
weapons-objects.one_liner: A symbolic headpiece representing sovereign authority and victory.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Absolute power, divine right, and the peak of achievement.

weapons-objects.name: Crystal Ball
weapons-objects.one_liner: A crystal or glass ball and common fortune telling object.
weapons-objects.symbolism: The unknown future, mysticism, and the desire to know fate.

weapons-objects.name: Dagger
weapons-objects.one_liner: A knife with a very sharp point and usually two sharp edges, designed for thrusting.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Treachery (Caesar), stealth, and intimacy of violence.

weapons-objects.name: Desert Eagle
weapons-objects.one_liner: A large-framed, semi-automatic pistol known for its massive stopping power and imposing presence.
angles: movie star of the gun world
weapons-objects.symbolism: Overwhelming power, status, and intimidation.

weapons-objects.name: Diamond Chain
weapons-objects.one_liner: A heavy metal chain encrusted with diamonds, a primary status symbol in hip-hop culture.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Wealth, achievement, vanity, and cultural identity.

weapons-objects.name: Double Cup
weapons-objects.one_liner: Two stacked Styrofoam cups used to serve 'lean' or 'dirty sprite'.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Southern rap culture, indulgence, and a slowed-down perception of time.

weapons-objects.name: Garrote Wire
weapons-objects.one_liner: A handheld ligature of chain, rope, scarf, wire or fishing line used to strangle a person.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Professional assassination, mafia hits, and cold-blooded murder.

weapons-objects.name: Glock 17
weapons-objects.one_liner: The polymer-framed standard for reliability and simplicity in modern firearms.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Efficiency, modern street power, and clinical reliability.

weapons-objects.name: Gold Bar
weapons-objects.one_liner: A brick of refined metallic gold, the universal standard for wealth and stability.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Wealth, permanence, power, and the ultimate value.

weapons-objects.name: Grenade
weapons-objects.one_liner: A small bomb typically thrown by hand.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Sudden chaos, last resort, and indiscriminate damage.

weapons-objects.name: Guillotine
weapons-objects.one_liner: A heavy blade sliding in vertical guides, used for beheading.
weapons-objects.symbolism: The ultimate end of power, radical revolution, and clinical execution.

weapons-objects.name: Hourglass
weapons-objects.one_liner: An ancient device measuring the relentless passage of time through falling sand.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Mortality, the urgency of the moment, and the cyclical nature of life.

weapons-objects.name: Katana
weapons-objects.one_liner: The traditional single-edged sword of the Japanese samurai, representing precision, honor, and deadly skill.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Precision, discipline, honor, and lethal elegance.

weapons-objects.name: Kunai
weapons-objects.one_liner: A Japanese tool originally used for farming, adapted into a weapon by ninjas.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Improvisation, ninja utility, and anime popularity (Naruto).

weapons-objects.name: Landmine
weapons-objects.one_liner: An explosive device concealed under or on the ground and designed to destroy or disable enemy targets.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Hidden consequences, the lingering scars of conflict, and entrapment.

weapons-objects.name: MAC-10
weapons-objects.one_liner: A boxy, high-rate-of-fire machine pistol synonymous with rapid delivery.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Chaos, overwhelming force, and DIY grit.

weapons-objects.name: Machete
weapons-objects.one_liner: A broad, heavy knife used as an implement like an axe, or in combat like a short sword.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Survival against nature, rebellion, and raw violence.

weapons-objects.name: Molotov Cocktail
weapons-objects.one_liner: A crude incendiary device consisting of a bottle filled with flammable liquid and a rag wick.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Resistance, urban insurrection, and low-cost devastation.

weapons-objects.name: Nunchucks
weapons-objects.one_liner: A traditional Okinawan martial arts weapon consisting of two sticks connected by a short chain or rope.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Martial arts mastery, speed, and flashy skill.

weapons-objects.name: Pepper Spray
weapons-objects.one_liner: A lachrymatory agent used in policing, riot control, crowd control, and self-defense.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Self-defense, crowd suppression, and blinding pain.

weapons-objects.name: Poison Ring
weapons-objects.one_liner: A ring with a container under the bezel or inside the band that can be used to hold poison.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Court intrigue, feminine lethality, and treacherous luxury.

weapons-objects.name: Rocket-Propelled Grenade (RPG)
weapons-objects.one_liner: A shoulder-fired missile weapon that launches rockets equipped with an explosive warhead.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Asymmetric warfare, heavy firepower, and revolutionary imagery.

weapons-objects.name: Sawed-Off Shotgun
weapons-objects.one_liner: A shotgun with a shortened barrel for a wider spread and easier concealment.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Uncompromising power, DIY lethality, and outlaw status.

weapons-objects.name: Shuriken
weapons-objects.one_liner: A Japanese concealed weapon that is thrown, often star-shaped.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Ninja stealth, distraction tactics, and cinematic action.

weapons-objects.name: Skeleton Key
weapons-objects.one_liner: A master key designed to open many different locks.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Omnipotence, the ability to bypass any barrier, and secret knowledge.

weapons-objects.name: Sledgehammer
weapons-objects.one_liner: A large, heavy hammer used for breaking through walls and obstacles.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Total demolition, brute force, and breaking down barriers.

weapons-objects.name: Sniper Rifle
weapons-objects.one_liner: A high-precision-rifle designed for sniper missions, capable of extreme range.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Cold detachment, extreme skill, and unseen danger.

weapons-objects.name: Snub-Nose Revolver
weapons-objects.one_liner: A short-barreled revolver optimized for concealment and close-quarters reliability.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Secrecy, last-ditch defense, and hard-boiled noir aesthetics.

weapons-objects.name: Stack of Cash
weapons-objects.one_liner: A physical bundle of currency, the ultimate scoreboard and motivator.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Tangible success, the fruits of labor (legal or illegal), and power.

weapons-objects.name: Switchblade
weapons-objects.one_liner: A spring-loaded folding knife that snaps into action with a click.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Immediacy, street-level tension, and 1950s/60s delinquency.

weapons-objects.name: Taser
weapons-objects.one_liner: An electroshock weapon used to incapacitate people, allowing them to be approached and handled in an unresisting state.
weapons-objects.symbolism: State control, non-lethal submission, and sudden incapacitation.

weapons-objects.name: Tomahawk
weapons-objects.one_liner: A light axe used as a tool or weapon by Indigenous peoples of North America.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Warrior spirit, versatility, and historical conflict.

weapons-objects.name: Uzi
weapons-objects.one_liner: The compact Israeli submachine gun that became a 1980s cinematic and street icon.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Rapid fire, urban warfare, and 80s/90s era dominance.

weapons-objects.name: Voodoo Doll
weapons-objects.one_liner: An effigy into which pins are inserted, popularly believed to harm the person whom it represents.
weapons-objects.symbolism: Revenge, control over others, and misunderstood religious practices.

writing-tools.name: Ableton Live
writing-tools.one_liner: A DAW designed for live performance and creative loop-based composition.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Allows for non-linear composition and live improvisation with audio and MIDI.

writing-tools.name: Akai MPC
writing-tools.one_liner: The Music Production Center, a sampler/sequencer that defined the sound of golden era hip-hop.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Allows producers to sample vinyl, chop it up, and play it back rhythmically on pads.

writing-tools.name: AlphaSmart
writing-tools.one_liner: A retro, portable word processor with a keyboard and a tiny screen, loved for its distraction-free nature.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Allows typing text files on the go with massive battery life and no internet.

writing-tools.name: Bear
writing-tools.one_liner: A beautifully designed, minimalist writing app for Apple devices that uses hashtags for organization.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Provides a frictionless writing environment with powerful tagging.

writing-tools.name: Blackwing 602
writing-tools.one_liner: A legendary pencil known for its unique rectangular eraser and smooth graphite, favored by Steinbeck and Disney animators.
bar_seeds: half the pressure twice the speed
writing-tools.what_it_does: Provides a uniquely smooth writing experience with a replaceable eraser.

writing-tools.name: ChatGPT
writing-tools.one_liner: An advanced AI language model capable of generating creative text, brainstorming rhymes, and structuring ideas.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Generates human-like text based on user prompts.

writing-tools.name: Claude
writing-tools.one_liner: An AI assistant known for its more natural, nuanced, and safe conversational style.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Provides conversational AI assistance with a focus on safety and constitutional principles.

writing-tools.name: Cut-Up Method
writing-tools.one_liner: A Dadaist technique popularized by William S. Burroughs to rearrange text and find new meaning.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Involves cutting up finished text and rearranging it to create a new text.

writing-tools.name: Dictaphone
writing-tools.one_liner: A classic voice recording device used for dictation and capturing verbal notes.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Records audio onto magnetic tape or digital memory.

writing-tools.name: Dictionary.com
writing-tools.one_liner: The go-to digital lexicon for definitions and pronunciation.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Provides definitions, pronunciations, and origin of words.

writing-tools.name: Etymology Online
writing-tools.one_liner: A deep dive into the history and origins of words.
writing-tools.what_it_does: Traces the development of words from their origins to present day.
workflow_hooks: Trace a word back to Sanskrit

writing-tools.name: Evernote
writing-tools.one_liner: A long-standing note-taking app designed for capturing and organizing everything from lyrics to voice memos.
